Cayden has cerebral palsy, but Conner hasn\u2019t let that stop him from playing sports with his brother. Competing in triathlons together, Conner tows Cayden behind in a raft during the swimming leg, tows him behind his bike during the cycling portion, and pushes him during the run. \n\nCayden and Conner were just honored in New York City -- winning \"2012 SportsKids of the Year\u201d from Sports Illustrated Kids.  Sports has been a bond for the brothers to come together - and inspires everyone who hears their story.  Duke Coach Mike Krzyzewski announced at the Event that Conner and Cayden \"have scholarships waiting for them at Duke\" when they get older.  Miami Heat star LeBron James said that the brothers should \"get ready for the private plane\" that is going to take them from their home in Tennessee to Miami to \"meet the guys.\"  \n\nWe are told that even Jay-Z and Beyonc\u00e9 couldn't wait to shake hands with Conner and Cayden, at the event.\n\nFor more info, check out:  http://goo.gl/HHOsD \n\nAnd you can give a shout-out to the brothers, at Team Long Brothers.\n\nJoin our community where Everyone Matters!\n\n(Thanks to Kalina Laree Quinton Ewing for flagging!)"}

{"picture": "https://fbexternal-a.akamaihd.net/safe_image.php?d=AQCMPWz9b-gtpKaI&w=154&h=154&url=http%3A%2F%2Fmadeinafreeworld.org%2Ffb_icon.png", "from": {"category": "University", "name": "Texas A&M Sustainability", "category_list": [{"id": "108051929285833", "name": "College & University"}], "id": "140471500738"}, "name": "Slavery Footprint", "privacy": {"value": ""}, "actions": [{"link": "https://www.facebook.com/140471500738/posts/140265969415982", "name": "Comment"}, {"link": "https://www.facebook.com/140471500738/posts/140265969415982", "name": "Like"}], "updated_time": "2011-12-07T20:58:16+0000", "caption": "slaveryfootprint.org", "link": "http://slaveryfootprint.org/", "created_time": "2011-12-07T20:58:16+0000", "message": "When we think about sustainability most of the time we focus on the environment.  When we want to learn how much our actions impact the environment we calculate our carbon footprint.  However, sustainability is about more than just the environment, it\u2019s also about doing what is good for people.  Most of the time we think about slavery as being something that happened in the past, but millions of people are being forced to labor as slaves every day.  They are working for all of us, we may not see it, but they are part of the supply chain that creates all the things we use and buy every day.  Things like smartphones, diamonds, and clothes utilize slave labor in the production process.  Instead of computing your carbon footprint, compute your Slavery Footprint and find out how many slaves are working to give you the lifestyle you enjoy today.  Follow the link below to get started and find out how you can help rid the world of slavery\u2026\n ", "icon": "https://fbstatic-a.akamaihd.net/rsrc.php/v2/yD/r/aS8ecmYRys0.gif", "type": "link", "id": "140471500738_140265969415982", "status_type": "shared_story", "description": "How many slaves work for you? There are 27 million slaves in the world today. Many of them contribute to the supply chains that end up in the products we use every day. Find out how many slaves work for you, and take action."}
